author: Universal do Reino do Deus
title: SPIRITUALITY WITHOUT GOD LEADS TO THIS
text:
SPIRITUALITY WITHOUT GOD LEADS TO THIS
Having a religion means nothing. Humans must exercise their spirituality and faith in the true God. Understand.
Every human carries spirituality within them.
God created us like this so that we may be able to seek Him. However, the lack of knowledge leads to suffering, and a Godless spirituality manifests itself in three ways: idolatry, superstition and self-adoration. None of them truly satisfies the soul. There is only one way to do this: find out in the video!
https://www.universal.org/renato-cardoso/post/espiritualidade-sem-deus-da-nisso/

author: Haley Bartlett
title: Your guide to the 2024 Lookout Wild Film Festival in Chattanooga, TN - NOOGAtoday
text: The 12th annual [Lookout Wild Film Festival](https://lwff.org/) is returning to set up camp at the Walker Theater this Thursday, Jan. 11 through Sunday, Jan. 14. Let us direct you on how to make the most out of this event. Whether you’re an outdoor enthusiast or just really love a good independent film, this festival has it all. From surfing in Norway and rhino conversation to rock climbing in Afghanistan and gravel biking in East Tennessee, these movies will take you on a different adventure with each new title screen. Lineup The festival will showcase 60+ films (shorts and features) — check out the [full lineup](https://lwff.org/films/) for each day. For a sneak peek of what to expect, here are four films that are based on our very own Tennessee Valley. [“A Couple of Screws Loose”](https://lwff.org/films/a-couple-of-screws-loose/) | Thursday, Jan. 11 | 7 p.m. | 32 minutes | Travel with two bike-packers who take on three of the hardest gravel bike rides in the southeast in just three days. [“Mecca in the Making”](https://lwff.org/films/mecca-in-the-making/) | Friday, Jan. 12 | 7 p.m. | 16 minutes | Get a glimpse of the “remarkable rebirth of Chattanooga” through collective action. [“The Conservation Kid”](https://lwff.org/films/the-conservation-kid/) | Sunday, Jan. 14 matinee | 1 p.m. | 11 minutes | Watch the story of local Cash Daniels who began cleaning the Tennessee River at the age of six + his continued efforts over the last few years. [“Walls of Faith”](https://lwff.org/films/walls-of-faith/) | Sunday, Jan. 14 matinee | 1 p.m. | 17 minutes | See the chronicles of Zach LeClerc as he scales some of Chattanooga’s most scenic sites. Bonus: Get an opportunity to meet the folks behind some of the films with [special dinners](https://lwff.org/dinner/) offered on Saturday + Sunday. Let the credits roll, it’s time to [get your tickets](https://lwff.org/tickets/) for weekend or day passes.

author: @englishjagrannews
title: Amazon Faces Legal Action Over Labour Law Violations In Haryana: Report\n
text:
- By
[Imran Zafar](/authors/imran-zafar) - Published: Sun, 01 Dec 2024 05:44 PM (IST)
- Source:JND
Amazon is under prosecution in an Indian court for alleged labour law violations at its warehouse near Haryana’s Manesar. The case follows a labour inspection earlier this year that flagged inadequate safety measures and legal non-compliance, according to documents obtained by Al Jazeera through India’s Right to Information (RTI) Act. The Haryana government has filed a case based on the inspection findings, with the next court hearing set for December 10.
Allegations Of Unsafe Working Conditions
The investigation was initiated after reports emerged of an incident in May where workers were allegedly coerced into forgoing breaks, including for water or restroom use, to meet performance targets. The inspection revealed multiple violations, including the absence of protective clothing for female workers near machinery, which is a clear breach of India’s labour laws, reported Al Jazeera.
Amazon's internal inquiry confirmed that a manager enforced such a pledge as a “motivational exercise,” which the company later described as an “unfortunate and isolated” incident. Disciplinary action was taken, though details remain undisclosed.
The inspection report highlighted Amazon's failure to provide necessary safety equipment and to maintain legally mandated records. Workers were also reportedly not issued employment identity cards. The lack of tight-fitting clothing for female workers near moving machinery was deemed a significant safety hazard, potentially leading to serious injuries, the report stated.
ALSO READ: [Kashmiri Pandit Women To Retain Migrant Status Despite Marriage To Non-Migrants: J-K High Court](https://english.jagran.com/india/kashmiri-pandit-women-to-retain-migrant-status-despite-marriage-to-non-migrants-jk-high-court-10204312)
Court Proceedings And Amazon's Response
The Haryana government submitted the inspection report as evidence to a Gurugram court, which summoned Amazon to appear on October 28. The hearing was adjourned and the case will resume on December 10. Amazon, in response to inquiries, stated that it had not received a copy of the inspection report and could not comment on the court proceedings, citing the case’s sub-judice status.
Worker Complaints
Amazon workers also raised concerns about stringent performance targets and constant surveillance. One worker, identified as Supriya, stated they are expected to stow 150 items per hour, adding that missing the target invites negative feedback. The monitoring includes tracking every minute spent on work or breaks, increasing stress levels.
ALSO READ: [Punjab: Farmer Groups To Hold Foot March Towards Delhi On December 6 For Legal Guarantee On MSP](https://english.jagran.com/india/punjab-farmer-groups-to-hold-foot-march-towards-delhi-on-december-6-for-legal-guarantee-on-msp-10204304)
Broader Scrutiny Of Amazon's Labour Practices
Globally, Amazon’s labour practices have come under intense scrutiny, with workers in the US and UK voicing similar grievances. A survey by the Amazon India Workers Association and UNI Global Union found that over 80 per cent of warehouse workers in India struggled to meet the company’s targets. Amazon dismissed the survey as “factually incorrect.”

author: Sofía Calderón
title: Renata del Castillo es hospitalizada de emergencia; la actriz de Como dice el dicho está deshauciada
text:
Renata del Castillo -de 42 años de edad- la actriz de Como dice el dicho, a través de redes sociales compartió a sus seguidores que tuvo que ser hospitalizada de emergencia; esto es lo que se sabe.
En 2022, Renata del Castillo fue diagnosticada con cáncer cérvicouterino; enfermedad que ha llevado a la actriz a permanecer en constantes tratamientos.
Sin embargo, en 2024 anunció que había renunciado a dichos tratamientos contra el cáncer.
Recientemente, Renata del Castillo compartió en sus historias de Instagram, la operarían de emergencia por posible trombosis.
Renata del Castillo termina en el hospital de emergencia por una posible trombosis
Por medio de su cuenta oficial de Instagram, la actriz Renata del Castillo, reveló a través de un video, la operarían de emergencia por posible trombosis o un preinfarto.
En una camilla de hospital, Renata del Castillo saludó a sus seguidores y, señaló, todo comenzó con un fuerte dolor en los omóplatos, para después pasar a su brazo.
Este dolor alertó a la oncóloga de la actriz, quien le solicitó acudir rápidamente al hospital.
Renata del Castillo revela que, posiblemente por la inmunoterapia que recibió hace unos días, podría tratarse de una trombosis.
“La oncóloga me dijo hace rato que me viniera ya, porque por la inmunoterapia, que por fin ya la recibí el martes, puede ser una trombosis.”RENATA DEL CASTILLO
A su vez, Renata del Castillo menciona que esta trombosis también tendría que ver con coágulos que se le están formando por los medicamentos que está consumiendo.
Finalmente, Renata del Castillo se despide de sus seguidores pidiendo orar por ella.
“Así es que, me van a hacer todos los análisis, pidiéndole a Dios que todo salga bien. Oren por mí.”RENATA DEL CASTILLO
Renata del Castillo ha pedido apoyo para su tratamiento contra el cáncer
En julio de 2024, Renata Castillo compartió padecía cáncer en fase terminal; por lo que pidió apoyo económico a sus seguidores para su tratamiento.
A través de redes sociales, Renata del Castillo señaló había un tratamiento alternativo para poder prolongar su vida; sin embargo, debía de juntar 190 mil pesos.
“En esta ocasión quiero suplicarles que me ayuden a juntar para mi tratamiento. Quiero tocar su corazón. Necesito juntar 190 mil pesos para la duración de mi tratamiento. Quiero suplicarles que me ayuden”RENATA DEL CASTILLO
Asimismo, la actriz expresa su deseo de continuar en vida para permanecer más tiempo junto a su hijo Mateo.

author: Emily Van de Riet
title: 3 men found dead in friend’s backyard after watching Chiefs game: ‘None of the stories are adding up’
text:
KANSAS CITY, Mo. ( KCTV /Gray News) – Multiple families are searching for answers after three men were mysteriously found dead in the backyard of another friend’s home in Kansas City after watching a Chiefs game together.
The three men who died have been identified as Ricky Johnson, 38; Clayton McGeeney, 36; and David Harrington, 37.
The three men were at the rental home of a fourth friend, Jordan Willis. A fifth unidentified friend was also there, officials said.
KCTV reports that the friends gathered at Willis’ rental home on Jan. 7 to watch the Kansas City Chiefs game together.
Two days later, the bodies of Johnson, McGeeney and Harrington were found in the backyard.
(From left to right): The three men who died have been identified as David Harrington, 37; Ricky Johnson, 38; and Clayton McGeeney, 36. (GoFundMe) Officers responded to the home that night after receiving a call from McGeeney’s fiancée.
She told police she went to the house looking for McGeeney. When no one answered the door, she broke into the basement of the home to look for him.
During her search, she told police she found the three bodies in the backyard and called 911.
The Kansas City Police Department said detectives are still waiting on results from the medical examiner’s office to determine causes of death.
However, they said there were no obvious signs of foul play.
But the men’s families said things just aren’t adding up.
Jordan Willis’ attorney John Picerno told KCTV that his client had “absolutely nothing to do with the deaths of his three friends.”
Picerno said the men have all been friends since high school, and that Willis is grieving their deaths.
Willis has since moved out of the home where the deaths occurred.
“He’s grieving, he’s had to move out of his home, he’s had to shut down his social media, he’s taking leave of absence from his job, so it’s really affected him,” Picerno said.
Picerno said the unidentified fifth friend left the home after the Chiefs game around 1 a.m. Then, he said, Willis decided to go to bed around 2 a.m. on the couch.
“Then in the early morning hours, around 2 a.m., [Willis] believes, he got sleepy and said, ‘I’m going to crash on the couch,’” Picerno said. “He said goodbye to his buddies, and he thought that they left out the front door.”
Picerno said that was the last time Willis saw his friends, and he was unaware their bodies were in his backyard for nearly two days until police responded to the home after McGeeney’s fiancée found them.
“… He didn’t know anything about them being in his backyard until police knocked on the door Tuesday evening at approximately 10 p.m.,” Picerno said.
When Picerno was asked why Willis didn’t go outside for two days, he said, “[Willis] had no reason to go out into the backyard, and he didn’t know anyone was in the backyard.”
Adriana Juarez (right), who shares a child with Johnson, told KCTV things aren’t adding up. (KCTV5) Adriana Juarez, who shares a child with Johnson, told KCTV that things aren’t adding up.
“None of the stories are adding up about what [Willis] is saying. How do you not know there are three dead bodies on the back porch?” Juarez said.
The case has gained national attention on social media, leaving many people wondering what happened. But Picerno remains adamant that his client is just as confused about the deaths as everyone else.
“He doesn’t have any suspicions about how they died any more than you or I do, or, unfortunately, the families who are grieving over the loss of their loved ones,” Picerno said.
He continued, “Jordan [Willis] had absolutely nothing to do with their deaths. He does not know the timing or manner of their deaths, nor does he know how or when they exited his house. He had no knowledge that they remained in his backyard or that they needed medical attention. Had he known, he certainly would have called for help. The last time he saw them was when they left his house, and he went to bed.”
Family members are pushing for answers, and they say they hope the attention the case is getting will get them closer to knowing what happened.
“I never thought it would get as much attention as it has, but I’m hoping with the attention that it will get us closer to getting answers,” said Johnson’s niece, Stephanie Walling.
Alan McGeeney, Clayton McGeeney’s cousin, told KCTV his family is shocked, confused, and beyond devastated because of his death.
“100% I think the situation is strange,” Alan McGeeney said. “It just hasn’t really set in; I don’t think it will.”
He added, “I’m not looking for anyone’s head or anything, but my cousin was frozen to the dirt for two days.”
Picerno said Willis allowed officers to search his home when they arrived Tuesday night.
He also said that family members of the men did try to contact Willis when the men never came home after the Chiefs game.
Picerno explained , in part, “Two people came to his house; however, he did not hear them as he sleeps with air buds and a loud fan. One of those people, the wife of one of the deceased, tried to reach him via Facebook messenger. Unfortunately, he did not see this message until after the police contacted him. Two of his friends parked their cars on the street, and there were no cars parked in his driveway. Jordan did not notice the cars in the street.”
GoFundMe pages have been set up for all three of the men.
McGeeney’s fundraiser says his fiancée, who found the bodies, is left with the cost of a funeral and now must transition to a single-income household.
Johnson’s fundraiser says he was “an adored father to his three beautiful daughters, but also a cherished son, brother, uncle, and friend.”
Harrington’s fundraiser , set up by his mother, says “I now have to put my son to rest. This was something we did not expect as no parent ever does.”
Police said the investigation is ongoing, and the medical examiner has not yet announced the causes of death.
Copyright 2024 KCTV via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.

author: cts.com.tw
title: 美國與伊朗緊張升溫 傳美撤減駐伊拉克大使館人員 - 華視新聞網
text:
中央社
（中央社華盛頓/巴格達11日綜合外電報導）路透社報導，4名美國及2名伊拉克消息人士今天表示，由於中東地區安全風險升高，美國正準備將駐伊拉克大使館的人員部分撤離，並將讓美方軍眷離開中東一帶的地點。
這些消息人士並未具體說明是何種安全風險。相關消息已刺激油價勁揚逾4%。
法新社報導，伊朗今天威脅說，若爆發衝突，他們將攻擊美國在中東的軍事基地。美國總統川普（Donald Trump）先前表示，他對於與伊朗達成核協議一事「信心有所下降」。
報導還引述數名美國官員的說法，稱美國顧及安全疑慮，正在減少駐伊拉克大使館的人員。
其中1位要求匿名的官員表示：「依據我方最新分析，我們決定減少駐伊拉克外交人員的規模。」（譯者：陳正健/核稿：張正芊）1140612
新聞來源：中央社

author: AB Newswire
title: PMI Consultant Evolves into Universal Talk Solutions to Address Surge in Language Service Demand | dailytimesleader.com | Serving West Point & Clay County Since 1867
text:
Florida - PMI Consultant, a cornerstone in business consulting, proudly unveils a strategic evolution to meet the evolving needs of its clientele. Bolstered by a remarkable surge in demand for language services, PMI Consultant is embarking on a forward-thinking transformation, creating a specialized division—Universal Talk Solutions—solely devoted to delivering comprehensive linguistic solutions.
The genesis of this transformative move is rooted in a substantial shift in demand dynamics. The year 2023 witnessed an unprecedented sevenfold increase in interpretation cases compared to business consulting, prompting a proactive response from PMI Consultant. Recognizing this significant trend, the company made the strategic decision to establish Universal Talk Solutions as an independent entity under the PMI umbrella.
"As PMI Consultant, we've always been dedicated to delivering exceptional business consulting and support to our community. The landscape changed dramatically in 2023 when we observed a sevenfold increase in demand for language services over consulting cases. This pivotal realization became the driving force behind the decision to create Universal Talk Solutions," explains Pedro Raphael, CEO at PMI Consultant.
Effective November 2023, Universal Talk Solutions will stand as a distinct division, catering exclusively to the rising demand for translation of documents, onsite interpretation, and phone interpretation for medical and business needs. This strategic shift positions the company to better streamline and enhance the delivery of language services, acknowledging the unique challenges businesses face in today's interconnected world.
"Universal Talk Solutions is more than a new name; it's a reflection of our dedication to providing seamless communication solutions," adds Pedro Raphael.
With a team of over 500 interpreters and translators, Universal Talk Solutions is well-equipped to meet the diverse and growing language requirements of its clients. The division is supported by cutting-edge technological solutions, including a proprietary CRM system, ensuring efficiency and precision in every language service provided.
"The decision to create Universal Talk Solutions was not only a response to demand but a strategic move to deliver language solutions with the same dedication and excellence our clients expect. This new division embodies our commitment to providing specialized linguistic services tailored to the evolving needs of our community," adds Pedro Raphael.
For more information about Universal Talk Solutions and its range of language services, please visit https://universaltalksolutions.com or contact (855) 392-2122.
About PMI Consultant:
PMI Consultant has been a reputable provider of business consulting and support services, earning trust within the community. Acknowledging the surge in demand for language services, PMI Consultant expands its offerings with the creation of Universal Talk Solutions, a dedicated division focused on specialized language services. For more information, visit https://universaltalksolutions.com
Media Contact
Company Name: UniversalTalk Solutions
Contact Person: Pedro Raphael
Email: Send Email
Country: United States
Website: www.universaltalksolutions.com

author: /author/ians/
title: Schools in Delhi to resume physical classes as Supreme Court eases anti-pollution measures
text:
Schools in Delhi to resume physical classes as Supreme Court eases anti-pollution measures
By [IANS](/author/ians/) | Published: December 6, 2024 04:15 AM2024-12-06T04:15:58+5:302024-12-06T04:20:05+5:30
New Delhi, Dec 6 All government and private schools in the national capital will resume physical classes with ...
New Delhi, Dec 6 All government and private schools in the national capital will resume physical classes with immediate effect after the Directorate of Education (DoE) has issued a circular.
This decision comes after the Supreme Court allowed the Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) to implement the Graded Response Action Plan-II (GRAP) restrictions.
As per the Delhi government order, all the government and private schools in Delhi can conduct classes in physical mode with immediate effect.
"All government, government-aided, and unaided recognised private schools under the DoE, NDMC, MCD, and Delhi Cantonment Board are required to conduct all classes in physical mode with immediate effect," the circular said.
On November 17, in-person classes were shifted to online mode, except for classes 10 and 12, due to the 'severe plus' air quality index in the national capital.
However, on November 18, offline classes for classes 10 and 12 were also moved online.
The Centre's air quality panel for Delhi-NCR revoked restrictive pollution control measures under stages 3 and 4 of the anti-pollution control plan for winters, according to an official order.
The restrictions have been reduced to Stage 2 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) which involves less stringent curbs such as a ban on the use of coal and firewood in industries and commercial establishments, including eateries.
Earlier on Thursday, the Supreme Court allowed the relaxation of stage 4 of the Graded Response Action Plan (GRAP) measures, which was in force to tackle the severe air quality in Delhi.
With the SC relaxation, the government will take a call in the next few hours on lifting the bans from certain activities.
The government may lift the ban on truck entry and a temporary halt on construction at public projects.
The authorities can also allow physical classes in schools and colleges.
Despite the easing of some restrictions, certain measures remain in effect under Stage Two. The use of coal and firewood, including tandoors in hotels, restaurants, and open eateries, continues to be prohibited.
Noting that the AQI level in the National Capital Region (NCR) did not cross 300 in the last four days, the top court told the CAQM that stage-3 curbs would be introduced if AQI crossed the 350 mark and stage-4 curbs if AQI crossed 400.
Delhiites breathed cleaner air for the second consecutive day on Thursday as the AQI was recorded in the "moderate" category with a reading of 165.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor
[Open in app](https://www.lokmattimes.com/install_app.htm?utm_source=www.lokmattimes.com&utm_medium=open_in_app&launch_url=https://www.lokmattimes.com/national/schools-in-delhi-to-resume-physical-classes-as-supreme-court-eases-anti-pollution-measures/)

author: Sophie Mann For Dailymail.Com
title: Maine's Democrat Governor Janet Mills is branded a LIAR by the National Weather Service after she claimed they didn't warn her historic storm would bring up to six inches of rain | Daily Mail Online
text: Maine 's Democrat Governor Janet Mills has been branded a liar by the National Weather Service after claiming its forecasters didn't warn her about a historic storm. The esteemed federal agency lashed Mills after she was slammed for failing to adequately warn locals that up to half a foot of rain would fall on December 18, causing huge floods and leaving 400,000 without power. Mills put her foot in it last Wednesday while touring flood-battered Kennebec County, saying: 'The National Weather Service did not predict five or six inches of rain in any community in Maine.' But a NWS spokesman said the 75 year-old lawmaker was talking nonsense, insisting state and local officials had been briefed about the impending inundation on December 15. And on Sunday the 17th - the day before the storm - the weather service met with state officials to further brief them on expected flooding, winds, and impact to the state's coast line. Governor Janet Mills is catching flack for saying the National Weather Service did not adequately predict the severe dimensions of the winter storm that hit Maine last week Cars are flooded in a parking lot at the Hathaway Creative Center alongside the Kennebec River, Tuesday, Dec. 19, 2023, in Waterville, Maine Mills and her office have not yet responded to the NWS's claims that she is a liar. Images of the storm's aftermath show cars hanging off extremely damaged roads, intense, murky floodwaters that swept other vehicles away, collapsed construction sites, and downed trees and powerlines. The storm, which Mills called 'an extraordinary event,' barreled into the Northeast on Monday, knocking out power to hundreds of thousands of people, forcing flight cancellations, and killing at least four people. Wind gusts reaches nearly 70 miles per hour, which Mills also said the National Weather Service did not predict. 'The National Weather Service did not predict 68-70 mile an hour winds in any area of Maine,' she said. 'It was an extraordinary event.' In fact, the NWS does seem to have predicted possible winds of 65-70 miles per hour at the same time that they predicted four-to-six inches of rain. Earlier this week, Mills announced the launch of an online resource for Maine residents who were hit hard by the flood and other storm damage. The Maine Flood Resources and Assistance Hub was launched on Tuesday. According to the governor's office, it will aggregate 'information, resources, and assistance' for those impacted by the storm. Propane tanks set free by flood waters discharge gas as they float on the Kennebec River through Augusta, Maine, Tuesday, Dec. 19, 2023 Nathan Sennett and Tori Grasse retrieve furniture from a flooded patio near the Kennebec River, Tuesday, Dec. 19, 2023, in Hallowell, Maine A car floats in a flooded parking lot at the Hathaway Creative Center alongside the Kennebec River in Waterville, Maine A man observes the flooded Kennebec River on December 19 in Maine The announcement of the hub arrived after civil states of emergency were declared in 14 of 16 counties in Maine. The severity of the storm's damage prompted Mills to request a Major Disaster Declaration from President Joe Biden, which will allow federal resources to supplement the recovery efforts led by the state. 'In the wake of last week’s storm, my Administration has launched the Maine Flood Resources and Assistance Hub to help Maine people with questions they may have about property damage, road safety, tree removal, and more,' Mills said in the news release about the resource hub. 'We will update this website as more information becomes available as part of our effort to do all we can to support the swiftest possible recovery of Maine communities.' The governor also announced Tuesday that the Federal Emergency Management Agency has approved the Maine Emergency Management Agency's request to begin an preliminary damage assessment, which is the first formal step toward request the aforementioned Major Disaster Declaration.

author: Notimerica
title: El Barça vence con calma al Athletic y optará a ganar su décima Copa de la Reina
text: MADRID, 14 Mar. (EUROPA PRESS) - El FC Barcelona Femení ganó este jueves por 2-1 al Athletic Club, con un gol y una asistencia de Mariona Caldentey, y se clasificó para la final de la Copa de la Reina, instancia donde optará a conquistar su décimo trofeo ante la Real Sociedad, vencedor de la otra semifinal. Después de un par de acercamientos amenazantes a la portería de las 'leonas', Caldentey acertó a batir a Mariasun Quiñones en el minuto 19. Un fallo de Nerea Nevado en un pase hacia atrás fue aprovechado por la '9' del Barça para pisar área y disparar ante el marcaje de Maddi Torre. Aunque Quiñones repelió el primer tiro, Caldentey remató por segunda vez en su rechace y anotó junto a un poste. Pese a encajar ese tanto y pese al 0-3 del encuentro de ida en San Mamés, las bilbaínas siguieron buscando el gol del honor, especialmente después del descanso. En el minuto 63, un error de la zaguera Ingrid Engen propició que Marta Sanadri robase el balón dentro del área culé y asistiera a Clara Pinedo, que marcó un golazo con la diestra. El empeño visitante casi tuvo mayor recompensa en el 67', con un cabezazo al larguero en un córner y que precedió a otro muy peligroso de la propia Sanadri a bocajarro. La guardameta blaugrana, Sandra Paños, estuvo rauda para atajar ese balón y evitar el 1-2 en el Estadi Johan Cruyff. De hecho, quien sí logró un segundo tanto fue el equipo local en el minuto 72, por obra de Patri Guijarro a raíz de un par de rechaces en un saque de esquina, seguidos por una asistencia con la cabeza de Caldentey. Con una volea de derechas cerca del área pequeña, Guijarro anotó el gol de la calma para un Barça que va lanzado hacia otro triplete nacional. Las pupilas de Jonatan Giráldez ya ganaron la Supercopa de España el pasado 20 de enero, exhibición incluida en la final (7-0 al Levante), y van destacadísimas en el liderato de la Liga F.
